page.title: 09HOUSES IN DALWOOD
page.content: The oldest house still standing in Dalwood is called Eastons. It was built in 1644. As were houses at that time, it is timber framed with cruck beams. A cruck beam is made by sawing a bent tree down the middle. Two other old houses are Brook Cottage, which was built in 1838, and Old Yew Cottage, which used to be two cottages but is now one. The newest houses are on two estates called Mowbars Hayes and Town Court. There is also a recently built house called Green Ends next to the church on land where there was once a farm.The two housing estates were also built on farm land.There are now around twice as many houses as there were twenty years ago. Many of the new houses are bungalows, as more retired people have moved into the village._
